name: Collegium Musicium
description: Study and performance of 17th and 18th century orchestral string repertoire from an historically aware perspective. Matters of style, dance forms, string techniques, and ornamentation will be applied to a variety of music for string ensemble. Beginning on modern instruments and period bows, period instruments may be introduced in the second term. The use and reading from 17th and 18th century editions and manuscripts will also be explored. The class will be conducted in a rehearsal/workshop format. There will be regular lectures/demos on baroque performance practices and related topics, and examination of 17th and 18th century source materials. Four hours minimum.
